title: Seamus Murphy
text:
GitHub
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  

      
My name is Seamus Murphy and I’m a registered professional forester with over 10 years of experience in forest mensuration and carbon monitoring, verification and report. I completed my PhD at SOAS, University of London in 2015 and an MSc in Environmental Forestry at Bangor University in 2019.
I currently work as a REDD+ Consultant at Winrock International, helping market-entry carbon programs and supporting jurisdictions in strengthening their monitoring, reporting, and verification (MRV) systems. I lead technical assistance to three national REDD+ programs and previously worked as a Validation and Verification Body (VVB) auditor with SCS Global Services, specializing in verification of VCS, ARB, ACR, and ART-TREES carbon offset projects. Prior to this, I held postdoctoral fellowships with the WorldFish Center and the University of Sussex, where my research focused on aquaculture markets across Egypt and Zambia. Through this work and subsequent projects involving geospatial and quantitative analyses, I repeatedly observed teams abandoning methods due to unclear documentation or resource constraints.
This experience sparked my passion for open source tools and reproducible science. I’ve committed to developing workflows in LiDAR processing, multispectral time series analysis, and carbon accounting systems using R and Python platforms. These workflows are specifically designed for testing with real users, including forestry technicians, carbon project developers, and government staff. My goal is to create reproducible and accessible workflows that clarify complex methodologies and empower project proponents. I bring this same commitment to field work and have designed field resources and tools including custom mobile applications for in-situ data scaling, GPS accuracy assessments (2020 & 2022), and training programs in equipment calibration and open-source survey deployment. I also facilitated theory of change workshops helping to drive development of company-wide geospatial strategies.
You can find my teaching resources and code repositories on my GitHub page, covering topics from Verra’s consolidated methodology (VM0048) to wildfire fuel typing and burn forecasting (CFFDRS), to validating allometric equations and running Monte Carlo uncertainty simulations (ART-TREES).

title: Projects
text:
WATBIO: Improvement of Water-Stressed Perennial Biomass Agrifuels


The WATBIO project investigates accelerated breeding for drought tolerance in poplar trees (Populus), silvergrass (Miscanthus) and Arundo. Researchers established new germplasm with increased drought tolerance in Populus and Miscanthus, and determined genetic diversity in Arundo. The project uses next generation sequencing technology to identify single gene-trait associations capturing priority genetic variations and allelic diversity, maintaining biomass productivity in water-scarce marginal lands unsuitable for food crops.





May 1, 2015












ZELS: Zoonoses and Emerging Livestock Systems


Zoonoses and emerging livestock systems program (ZELS) was a joint research and training initiative to tackle diseases that could pass from animals to humans. It aims to improve the health and wellbeing of animals, humans and the environment and, ultimately, enhance the lives of millions. Research grants with a total funding of £21.1 million, with a further £1.5 million for studentships. Eleven projects are funded across 11 developing countries, involving 19 UK research institutions and more than 30 overseas institutions.





May 28, 2016












STREAMS: Sustainable Transformation of Egyptian Aquaculture Market


The STREAMS project (CHF 1,999,573, SDC) aimed to increase production of inexpensive, nutritious and safe fish from sustainable aquaculture systems to improve health and nutrition of Egypt’s resource-poor while creating employment and increasing incomes. Managed by WorldFish with CARE as subcontractor, implemented across five governorates: Kafr-El-Sheikh, Fayoum, Behera, Sharkia and Menia. The project achieved significant results in transforming Egypt’s aquaculture value chain.





Oct 20, 2017












YEAG: Youth Employment in Aswan Governorate


The Swiss-funded YEAG project (CHF 586k) benefitted 1,976 fishermen, fish farmers, women fish retailers and young entrepreneurs. It supported aquaculture development, improved post-harvest handling and fish processing practices, and developed fisheries management in Lake Nasser. The project provided training and business support to more than 1,000 fishers, ensuring better livelihoods for beneficiaries in Aswan, Upper Egypt.





Nov 22, 2018












ACLiSAT: Advancing Climate Smart Aquaculture Technologies


The ACLiSAT project ($1.3m, IFAD) increases adoption of efficient aquaculture technologies in arid areas, improves engagement of women and youth in productive aquaculture, and enhances collaboration between IFAD, WorldFish and regional/national partners. The project strengthens capacity of national aquaculture institutions in Egypt, Eritrea and Ethiopia and promotes the adoption of climate-smart technologies by fish farming communities.





Mar 7, 2019












EWFIRE: Empowering Women Fish Retailers


The EWFIRE project (€396k, European Commission) focuses on making fish retailing more profitable by empowering women through technical training, market engagement and business leadership. Targeted value addition opportunities include post-harvest handling (chilling, cleaning, grading), fish processing (degutting, freezing, packaging), fish leather production, and associated fish marketing, pricing, trade contracting and consignment formalization.





Feb 24, 2020












ZAEDP: Zambia Aquaculture Enterprise Development Project


The Zambia Aquaculture Enterprise Development Project aims to stimulate a viable aquaculture subsector in Zambia to promote economic diversification, food security and sustainable employment generation. The project develops domestic aquaculture as a viable and inclusive business opportunity through enhanced production and productivity. Implemented in high potential zones across the country with three components: Support to Aquaculture Entrepreneurs, Growth Enabling Infrastructure, and Project Management. Total cost: USD 50.89 million (ADB loan: USD 45.4 million, GRZ: USD 5.49 million).





May 13, 2020












ERFI: Enhanced Forest Resource Inventories


This project implemented a comprehensive pointcloud-to-raster workflow for enhanced forest inventory, generating spatial estimates of Whole Stem Volume (m³/ha). The pipeline processes LiDAR data, derives key covariates including canopy height models and terrain features, and uses machine learning (Random Forest) to predict forest volume across landscapes. Services included individual stem detection, automated stand delineation, and stock table creation.





Jun 30, 2022












Darkwoods: Forest Carbon Project


The Nature Conservancy of Canada acquired the 54,792 ha Darkwoods Property near Creston, British Columbia, managing it for ecological conservation. NCC undertook a 100-year VCS IFM-LtPF forest carbon project to provide carbon finance for acquisition and ongoing management. The project achieves GHG emission reductions through avoided logging, implementing conservation management activities with minimal timber removal for ecosystem enhancement and risk management.





Aug 1, 2025












LEAF: Lowering Emissions by Accelerating Forest Finance Coalition


The LEAF Coalition is a voluntary global coalition bringing together the private sector and governments to provide carbon market finance for tropical and subtropical forest conservation. LEAF has mobilized $1 billion USD for forest country governments committed to protecting forests and reducing deforestation. The Coalition is on track to become one of the largest public-private efforts to protect tropical forests, with 23 jurisdictions potentially protecting up to half a billion hectares of forest.





Oct 14, 2025

title: Workshops
text:
Title



Role



Description



Date








Allometry Validation


Instructor


Statistical validation and calibration procedures for allometric biomass models compliant with ART-TREES requirements for carbon registry emissions reporting. Technical guidance in model selection methodology is specifically aimed at avoiding Types 1-4 statistical errors and over-fitting. Carbon registries mandate robust model selection protocols to monitor predictive accuracy for signs of systematic bias and apply correction through hyper parameter tuning.


Aug 2024






Integrated Mapping of Wetland Dynamics in an Endorheic Lake Basin: Weaving Remote Sensing & Community Mapping Methods Together


Instructor


Methodological workshop on integrating satellite remote sensing with participatory community mapping to monitor wetland dynamics and fishing activity in Lake Chilwa Basin, Malawi. The workflow combines a longitudinal Landsat time series (1994-2015), Sentinel-1 InSAR data, and extensive mixed-methods fieldwork to examine enforcement conflicts and management opportunities in Africa’s most densely populated wetland ecosystem.


Jan 2020






Monte Carlo REDD+ Uncertainty Analysis: ART-TREES Compliance Tools for Carbon Accounting & MRV Systems


Intstructor


Monte Carlo simulation framework for estimating uncertainty in REDD+ emission factors and activity data for ART-TREES Standard V2.0 compliance, featuring allometric modeling, biomass estimation uncertainty, cross-validation techniques, and automated uncertainty deduction calculations with 90% confidence intervals for jurisdictional and nested carbon verification projects


Dec 2024






ODK Survey Environment


Instructor


This ODK-derived field survey repository managed data collection for the Empowering Women Fish Retailers in Egypt (EWFIRE) project, sampling socioeconomic data from fish retailers across five urban centers in Sharkia governorate to assess economic constraints and value chain development opportunities informal operators.


Feb 2019

title: LiDAR
text:
Advanced LiDAR processing workflows and forest mensuration techniques for operational forestry applications.














LiDAR: Forest Height Analysis


Advanced forest structure analysis toolkit combining LiDAR and photogrammetric data for operational forest inventory planning. Features automated tree top detection algorithms, canopy height model generation, and stand structure characterization supporting efficient field plot allocation and sampling design. Includes crown delineation protocols, diameter-height relationship modeling, and accessibility analysis for optimizing field crew deployment in complex terrain environments.





Oct 15, 2023












LiDAR: Ash Dieback Stem Mapping


LiDAR workflow for mapping ash dieback disease (Hymenoscyphus fraxineus) using high-resolution point cloud data and field validation. Combines canopy metrics with ground data to detect disease progression patterns, quantify canopy gaps from ash mortality, and map stem distribution changes over time. Features automated algorithms for identifying healthy versus declining ash trees through LiDAR-derived crown metrics, supporting targeted forest health interventions and silvicultural planning in diseased stands.





Mar 12, 2022












LiDAR: Point Cloud Processing


End-to-end workflow for processing raw airborne LiDAR point cloud data into digital terrain models and normalized canopy height products. Features comprehensive ground point classification using Cloth Simulation Filter (CSF) and Progressive Morphological Filter (PMF) algorithms, automated noise removal protocols, and high-resolution Digital Terrain Model generation. Includes individual tree detection and crown segmentation methodologies, stems-per-hectare estimation using both point-based and raster-based approaches, and LAScatalog batch processing techniques for memory-efficient handling of large-scale datasets.





Feb 24, 2022





No matching items

title: Teaching
text:
VT0007: JREDD+ Risk Mapping


Risk assessment toolkit for Jurisdictional REDD+ programs implementing VT0007 methodology. Features geospatial analysis scripts for identifying and mapping deforestation risk factors, including proximity to infrastructure, agricultural pressure zones, and historical forest loss patterns. Integrates multiple satellite data sources (Landsat, Sentinel-2, MODIS) with socioeconomic indicators to generate probabilistic risk surfaces supporting strategic intervention planning and monitoring system design for jurisdictional-scale forest conservation programs.





Nov 6, 2024












ART-TREES: Demo Repository


Demonstration repository showcasing version control best practices for greenhouse gas calculation workflows under ART-TREES methodology. Features standardized Git workflows, automated testing frameworks, and documentation templates ensuring reproducible carbon accounting processes. Includes branching strategies for collaborative development, continuous integration pipelines for calculation validation, and release management procedures supporting transparent and auditable REDD+ project development.





Aug 11, 2025












ART-TREES: Allometry Validation


Validation and calibration procedures for allometric biomass models compliant with ART-TREES requirements. Technical guidance in model selection methodology for avoiding Types 1-4 statistical errors, bias corrections and hyperparameter tuning.





Feb 16, 2025












ART-TREES: Monte Carlo Tools


Monte Carlo simulation methods for estimating uncertainty of REDD+ emission factors and activity data in compliance with ART-TREES Standard V2.0. Features workflows for biomass estimation uncertainty analysis, allometric model error propagation, and activity data variance assessment using 10,000-iteration simulations with 90% confidence intervals. Includes specialized modules for cross-validation bias detection, spatial uncertainty modeling, and automated uncertainty deduction calculations that also incorporate best practices from CEOS LPV Biomass Protocol.





Dec 19, 2024












CFFDRS-2.0: Wildfire Risk Mapping


Operational workflow for wildfire risk mapping and fuel typing in accordance with the updated Canadian Forest Fire Danger Rating System (V2.0) for British Columbia’s Okanagan Watershed. This reproducible workflow integrates satellite-derived elevation data, gridded climate variables from Environment and Climate Change Canada weather stations, and BC Vegetation Resource Inventory (VRI) datasets. The methodology processes Digital Elevation Models, applies Inverse Distance Weighting interpolation for climate data, and implements Wotton and Beverly’s stand-adjusted fine-fuel moisture content model. Using the cffdrs R package, the workflow generates Fire Weather Index (FWI), Initial Spread Index (ISI), and Build-up Index (BUI) raster outputs. Features comprehensive fuel type classification based on species composition and stand density, producing Head Fire Index and Fire Intensity predictions to support operational fire management teams, researchers, and wildfire risk assessment applications.





Feb 24, 2022












Mapping Templates: Site Visualization


Suite of every-day maps used operational site mapping designed to support fieldwork and environmental analysis activities. This resource includes topographic, hydrographic, demographic, and watershed cartographic tools. Site maps were designed for supporting boundary identification and field access, with Locator inset maps also provided for helping users within quickly orientate themselves within local and national landscapes. A final section was added showcasing 3-D mapping of watershed delineation and topopgrahy useful for environmental impact assessments between upstream and downstream sites. These templates serve as practical tools for researchers, environmental analysts, and field professionals requiring standardized every-day mapping solutions for site orientation and operational planning.





Dec 4, 2024












LiDAR: Forest Height Analysis


Advanced forest structure analysis toolkit combining LiDAR and photogrammetric data for operational forest inventory planning. Features automated tree top detection algorithms, canopy height model generation, and stand structure characterization supporting efficient field plot allocation and sampling design. Includes crown delineation protocols, diameter-height relationship modeling, and accessibility analysis for optimizing field crew deployment in complex terrain environments.





Oct 15, 2023












LiDAR: Point Cloud Processing


End-to-end workflow for processing raw airborne LiDAR point cloud data into digital terrain models and normalized canopy height products. Features comprehensive ground point classification using Cloth Simulation Filter (CSF) and Progressive Morphological Filter (PMF) algorithms, automated noise removal protocols, and high-resolution Digital Terrain Model generation. Includes individual tree detection and crown segmentation methodologies, stems-per-hectare estimation using both point-based and raster-based approaches, and LAScatalog batch processing techniques for memory-efficient handling of large-scale datasets. Commissioned by BC Timber Sales for Enhanced Forest Inventory applications supporting operational forest mensuration and ecological analysis workflows.





Feb 24, 2022












LiDAR: Ash Dieback Stem Mapping


LiDAR workflow for mapping ash dieback disease (Hymenoscyphus fraxineus) using high-resolution point cloud data and field validation. Combines canopy metrics with ground data to detect disease progression patterns, quantify canopy gaps from ash mortality, and map stem distribution changes over time. Features automated algorithms for identifying healthy versus declining ash trees through LiDAR-derived crown metrics, supporting targeted forest health interventions and silvicultural planning in diseased stands.





Mar 12, 2022












Wetlands Mapping: SAR & Landsat Workflows


Framework for mapping endorheic wetland dynamics, combining Sentinel-1 InSAR processing with Landsat time series analysis (1994-2015), using water extraction indices (NDWI, MNDWI, AWEIsh) and spectral mixture analysis for sub-pixel water detection. Community mapping components include key informant interviews, focus group discussions, and rapid participatory appraisals capturing local ecological knowledge of seasonal fishing migration patterns and traditional resource management practices.





Jun 15, 2024












GeoODK Survey: Open Source Build


Open-source mobile data collection framework built on Open Data Kit (GeoODK) architecture for socioeconomic field surveys. Provides customizable survey templates, GPS-enabled data collection forms, with automated quality control protocols, multilingual support, and integrated statistical sampling tools using android mobile devices





Feb 5, 2018





No matching items
